li.a: Illinois Department of Public Health Immunization Reminder

p.span:
15501 East Avenue L
Lewistown, Illinois 61542
Phone: 309-547-5826

div.span: In order to show support for this year's seniors, Lewistown Community High School will be joining with other schools around the nation in a "Be the Light" celebration.
In doing so, we will provide one more "Friday Night Lights" experience for the Class of 2020.

On Friday night, April 17, from 8:20 to 8:40, the lights of all Lewistown athletic facilities will be turned on as a display of support and celebration. 20 minutes at 20:20 (8:20) for the Class of 2020!
Tough times don't last; tough people do. Lewistown Strong!

img.alt: Miss Michelle and the Easter Bunny

span.strong: In an effort to simplify communication with the district during this break, please call 309-267-9236 or message through Facebook.

p.span: Please complete the Census (if you haven't done so already)!

div.span: s. Serenity has created an online "Check-in" with her. If you or your children need to contact her about services, please fill out the "Check-in" or call
Our amazing social worker, Ms. Serenity, has provided this newsletter to help out with this very unusual time for our students.

p.span: Comcast Xfinity has opened up free hotspot connection for internet.
With so many of us staying at home, it is important that we still take care of ourselves. This informative chart can help us prepare for our time at home.

img.alt: How to prepare for staying at home
img.title: How to prepare for staying at home

span.strong: Congratulations to Anna Heffren for being named the "Small School Player of the Year"!
Congratulations to LHS senior Desitny Chapman for her winning Illinois State Library Census poster!

p.span: Find all of your scholarship information by clicking this link!

span.strong: Food delivery this week will be Monday and Thursday and each delivery will provide enough meals for the other days. Thursday’s delivery will also include weekend meals for those in the Backpack Program.
Please call 309-267-9236 with questions and concerns.
If you or your child has missed the bus/food drop off, please call the bus garage @ 309-267-4178.

strong.span: Food will be available for pickup at Central School from 12-1 for those who miss the food delivery at the bus stop.

p.span: The Governor has announced the closing of school for the remainder of the school year. Meals will continue to be delivered on Monday and Thursday. Students are required to check in daily. More information will follow.

span.strong: Message from the Peoria City/County Health Department:

div.span: COVID-19 information is evolving. We urge you to learn about the virus & what to do if you experience symptoms. Please call or visit:
CDC recommends that for the next 8 weeks, organizers cancel or postpone in-person events that consist of 50 people or more throughout the U.S.

span.a: More CDC information at this link.

span.strong: Comcast wants to help you with internet!

p.span: You may qualify for 60 days of free internet. Click here for info.
Free hotspot access. Click here for info.

br.span: The Farm Bureau has offered the use of their internet from 9-3 each weekday. You must bring your own device.

p.span: The CDC offers numerous hand washing resources for all grade levels, including:

span.span: Instructional videos for students, including one in Spanish
Instructional posters in eight languages to hang above sinks in restrooms
Fact sheets that can be downloaded in both English and Spanish to send home with students
